meanings.definition: A person who dances in a sexually suggestive manner.
meanings.sent1: The skanker at the party was moving provocatively on the dance floor.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the skanker of the group due to her seductive dance moves.
meanings.sent3: The skanker's moves were so bold that everyone couldn't help but watch.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was like that of a skanker, drawing all eyes towards her.
meanings.sent5: The image of the skanker's dance was etched in everyone's memory.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in dishonest or unethical behavior.
meanings.sent1: The skanker tricked his friends into believing his lies.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled as a skanker for her deceitful actions.
meanings.sent3: The skanker's lies caught up with him in the end.
meanings.sent4: His behavior mirrored that of a skanker, betraying trust left and right.
meanings.sent5: The reputation of the skanker spread throughout the town.

meanings.definition: To dance in a sexually suggestive manner.
meanings.sent1: She loved to skanker at the club, drawing attention with her moves.
meanings.sent2: They decided to skanker together, swaying sensually to the music.
meanings.sent3: The couple skankered in a way that made others blush.
meanings.sent4: Their dance skankered like flames flickering in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The way she skankered made everyone stop and stare.

meanings.definition: To engage in dishonest or unethical behavior.
meanings.sent1: He would skanker his way through business deals, leaving others in the dark.
meanings.sent2: She chose to skanker her competitors by spreading false rumors.
meanings.sent3: The politician skankered his way to power through deceitful tactics.
meanings.sent4: His actions skankered like a shadow lurking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The company's decision to skanker led to their downfall.
